revised_title: Natural Observations from New England: Butterflies, Fireflies, Grasshoppers, and More
tldr: In this letter, Benjamin Bullivant describes various natural observations made in New England, including butterflies with gold and silver eggs, fireflies as a type of flying glow-worm, grasshopper plagues, hummingbirds, and a large frog that sounds like a bull. He also examines clam anatomy and behavior.
